page.title: 07A BARNACLE FARMER
page.content: {Park Farm}in the family of the present owners since{1921}.It is a dairy farm and the bulk of the land is sown and fertilized grassland. The day starts at 6a.m. with milking and is geared to caring for the livestock.No slack period during the year and the busiest time is from early October onwards as animals are brought in for the winter and require feeding and cleaning out with extra care necessary as calves are born. A good milk cow is currently worth Â£600;an older animal fetchesÂ£450 at slaughter-usually at an abattoir at Crick,Rugby.The farmer found reward in 3 main areas:-job satisfaction,an open air life,and being his own boss.Least desirable aspects of his life were working in all weathers and on every day,including Christmas Day. _
